definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)

sentences.english: Put on your coat or you'll catch (a) cold.
sentences.chinese: 穿上大衣，要不你就會受涼的。

sentences.english: Therefore often cold and cold, it is trouble.
sentences.chinese: 也因此經常受涼而感冒，很是麻煩。

sentences.english: Fever is one manifestation of a cold.
sentences.chinese: 發燒是受涼的一種表現。

sentences.english: She looked the same as always, and fortunately the rain had not caused a chill.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去是老樣子，幸運的是，那雨沒有使她受涼。

sentences.english: She shook her head. "No, disciple, you cannot rest just yet."
sentences.chinese: 保好頭腳不受涼，其餘部位可無恙。

sentences.english: He enjoined me to be alert all the way for fear to catch a cold at night.
sentences.chinese: 他囑我路上小心，夜裏要警醒些，不要受涼。

sentences.english: They were getting cold in the cardboard box.
sentences.chinese: 由於小熊仔窩在紙盒子裏，被發現時已經有些受涼。

sentences.english: He then told me to be watchful all the time, and not catching cold at night.
sentences.chinese: 他囑咐我路上小心，夜裏要警醒些，不要受涼。

sentences.english: What Happens when Chicks Get Cold?
sentences.chinese: 當雛雞受涼時會發生什麼？

definition: yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
to feel suffocated or oppressed/to choke with resentment/to feel injured or resentful
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
